Accessible Clipboard Manager

- Command-line Python 3 script to manage clipboard history with strong accessibility features.
- Supports storing, listing, searching, and deleting clipboard entries.
- Persist clipboard history to a JSON file in the user’s home directory for offline-first operation.
- Keyboard-driven interface with clear text menus and numbered options to navigate without mouse.
- Supports copy-paste interaction via system clipboard using only standard library (e.g., subprocess on supported platforms).
- Provides a high-contrast text UI for visually impaired users; configurable text size and color scheme.
- Offers text-to-speech reading of clipboard entries via platform’s built-in tools (e.g., say on macOS, PowerShell on Windows) for screen reader support.
- Responsive layout adapts to terminal window size, wrapping text as needed.
- Includes a print-friendly export feature that outputs clipboard history in plain text for printing.
- Robust error handling for file I/O and clipboard access failures.
- Allows filtering clipboard entries by keywords with simple search.
- Works fully offline once installed; no external dependencies.
- Simple configuration via a JSON file to customize storage path and accessibility options.
- Designed for easy one-file deployment and usage with only standard Python 3 libraries.

(Generated: 2025-12-03T13:32:21.832695Z, seed=72501, theme=accessibility helpers, extras=responsive grid, offline-first with localStorage, print-friendly view, kind=py)
